2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending time with friends, enjoying the sunshine and anticipating a football game between Andorra and Portugal.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his classmates who were planning a prank on a teacher they disliked. He calmly explained his perspective, emphasizing empathy and understanding, and managed to persuade them to reconsider their actions. This experience solidified his belief in the power of peaceful resolution.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jacob Walker just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and will be watching the Andorra-Portugal game later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation, sharing stories, or simply relishing the pleasant atmosphere.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into a late-night showing of a classic horror film. The flickering images on the screen, the eerie soundtrack, and the palpable tension in the darkened theater ignited a thrill within him that he'd never experienced before. He reveled in the fear, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the shared experience of terror with his friends.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he convinced his friends to host a themed party at The Golden Fleece, transforming the quirky pub into a mock medieval banquet hall. He spent weeks meticulously crafting costumes, designing elaborate decorations, and planning intricate games, pouring his energy and passion into creating an unforgettable experience. He thrived on the chaos of the night, the laughter, the costumes, and the sheer absurdity of it all, reveling in the role of the master of ceremonies.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Answer: Alexander White would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with his friends.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: evasive and avoids taking responsibility for his mistakes.
          current daily occupation: likely watching the European football cup game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who appears to value his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Context for action selection and components

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that evening.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football matches in pubs. He appreciates a good atmosphere and has a favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He also seems to have a fondness for history and finds solace in old books.
          current daily occupation: likely unemployed and enjoying his leisure time.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with his friends and watching the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in lively conversation with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and anticipation of the upcoming game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden bookstore tucked away on a quiet side street. The musty scent of old paper and leather enveloped him as he browsed the shelves, discovering forgotten histories and untold stories. He felt a sense of belonging amidst the silent whispers of the past, a refuge from the chaotic uncertainty of adolescence.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching football matches in pubs. He appreciates a good atmosphere and has a favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He also seems to have a fondness for history and finds solace in old books.
          current daily occupation: likely unemployed and enjoying his leisure time.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with his friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It\'s the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.', '[14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I\'ll grab a round in when we get there.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: manipulative and enjoys being the center of attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of disappointment and resignation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who sent her love letters penned in elegant calligraphy. The truth was, Alice had written the letters herself, carefully crafting a persona of a mysterious, lovestruck suitor. The attention and envy she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control the narrative.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: manipulative and enjoys being the center of attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of disappointment and resignation.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who sent her love letters penned in elegant calligraphy. The truth was, Alice had written the letters herself, carefully crafting a persona of a mysterious, lovestruck suitor. The attention and envy she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control the narrative.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan.           Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game and is likely feeling thirsty and excited about it.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to The Golden Fleece pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be eager to get to the pub, catch up with his friends, and enjoy the atmosphere of the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into a late-night showing of a classic horror film. The flickering images on the screen, the eerie soundtrack, and the palpable tension in the darkened theater ignited a thrill within him that he'd never experienced before. He reveled in the fear, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the shared experience of terror with his friends.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he convinced his friends to host a themed party at The Golden Fleece, transforming the quirky pub into a mock medieval banquet hall. He spent weeks meticulously crafting costumes, designing elaborate decorations, and planning intricate games, pouring his energy and passion into creating an unforgettable experience. He thrived on the chaos of the night, the laughter, the costumes, and the sheer absurdity of it all, reveling in the role of the master of ceremonies.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:A quirky and eclectic pub with a focus on board games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation, sharing stories, or simply relishing the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Value

          current daily occupation: likely heading to The Golden Fleece to watch the football game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited and looking forward to spending time with his friends at the pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The Golden Fleece to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

The musty scent of old paper and leather enveloped him as he browsed the shelves, discovering forgotten histories and untold stories. He felt a sense of belonging amidst the silent whispers of the past, a refuge from the chaotic uncertainty of adolescence.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in lively conversation with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and anticipation of the upcoming game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The Golden Fleece to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage.
          core characteristics: a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a need for attention. She enjoys being in control and orchestrating situations to her liking, as evidenced by her childhood fabrication of a secret admirer and her attempts to sway her friends towards her preferred pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle frustration that her friends didn't immediately choose her preferred pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation where she needs to decide which pub to go to with her friends to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Black Swan.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who sent her love letters penned in elegant calligraphy. The truth was, Alice had written the letters herself, carefully crafting a persona of a mysterious, lovestruck suitor. The attention and envy she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control the narrative.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage.
          core characteristics: a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a need for attention. She enjoys being in control and orchestrating situations to her liking, as evidenced by her childhood fabrication of a secret admirer and her attempts to sway her friends towards her preferred pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement for the game and a subtle frustration that her friends didn't immediately choose her preferred pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.

          Value

Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation where she needs to decide which pub to go to with her friends to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who sent her love letters penned in elegant calligraphy. The truth was, Alice had written the letters herself, carefully crafting a persona of a mysterious, lovestruck suitor. The attention and envy she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control the narrative.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage
