2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          ['[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely a retired professional or someone who enjoys leisure activities.
          core characteristics: a man who avoids taking responsibility for his mistakes and tends to shift blame onto others. He values his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group. He also seems to appreciate a good deal, as evidenced by his preference for The Black Swan during the game due to their beer specials.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement and perhaps a tinge of frustration.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who appears to value his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual with a penchant for deflecting blame and a strong desire to maintain a positive social image among his friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan, even if they have already made other plans.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince the group to go to The Black Swan instead of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head to The Black Swan with Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob.
          [14 May 2015 11:30] Secure a good table at The Black Swan for the group.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Order drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Enjoy the Andorra vs Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual with a penchant for deflecting blame and a strong desire to maintain a positive social image among his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his classmates who were planning a prank on a teacher they disliked. He calmly explained his perspective, emphasizing empathy and understanding, and managed to persuade them to reconsider their actions. This experience solidified his belief in the power of peaceful resolution.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is spending the day with friends at Victoria Park and later plans to watch the Andorra-Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends to confirm their plans or head directly to The Golden Fleece.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual with a need for control and attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and possibly a bit resentful about the outcome of the previous night.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          Value

          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.

          Relevant memories:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          Current goal: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game..
          Current plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.
          Current situation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) No
          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is currently feeling disappointed, lonely, and fatigued. He is with friends at a market and they are deciding where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends but feels disappointed and lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably try to make the best of the situation and engage with his friends, hoping to lift his spirits.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends but feels disappointed and lonely.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably try to make the best of the situation and engage with his friends, hoping to lift his spirits.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports. He values tradition and familiarity, preferring his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. While he enjoys the company of his friends, he can be disappointed when plans don't go as expected.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed.

          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, as it's his preferred pub for watching football games with friends.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, as it's his preferred pub for watching football games with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are gathered and they are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social setting with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.

          core characteristics: a complex individual who values his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group. He appears to have a strong desire to maintain a positive social image and may deflect blame when faced with personal responsibility. He also demonstrates a preference for routine and familiarity, as evidenced by his fondness for The Black Swan pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince the group to go to The Black Swan instead of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head to The Black Swan with Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob.
          [14 May 2015 11:30] Secure a good table at The Black Swan for the group.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Order drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Enjoy the Andorra vs Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual who appears to value his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual with a penchant for deflecting blame and a strong desire to maintain a positive social image among his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan, even if they have already made other plans.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group. He appears to have a strong desire to maintain a positive social image and may deflect blame when faced with personal responsibility. He also demonstrates a preference for routine and familiarity, as evidenced by his fondness for The Black Swan pub.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual with a penchant for deflecting blame and a strong desire to maintain a positive social image among his friends.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where he and his friends are discussing where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night. They are considering The Golden Fleece pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch soccer games, and meeting up at markets. He seems to prefer The Golden Fleece pub over The Black Swan.

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, going to pubs to watch soccer games, and meeting up at markets. He seems to prefer The Golden Fleece pub over The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game. He could also try to convince Alexander White that The Golden Fleece is a better choice than The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual who craves attention and control.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage, particularly when it comes to social gatherings and choosing where to spend time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a little resentful.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative individual who craves attention and control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch a game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current goal: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub..
          Current plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.
          Current situation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group. He tends to deflect blame and prioritize maintaining a positive social image. He also seems to have a strong preference for his favorite pub, The Black Swan, and often attempts to persuade his friends to go there, even if they have other plans.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a bit frustrated with his friends' choice of pubs.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.         • Alexander White, Alexander White went to a pub to watch a game.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to his preferred pub.

          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.
