2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Golden Fleece.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at The Golden Fleece on May 14th but is planning to watch another game there on May 15th with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling disappointed and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a situation where he is feeling disappointed and lonely because his friends are not all going to the same pub to watch the game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would probably try to make the best of the situation and engage with his friends, hoping to lift his spirits.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation, sharing stories, or simply relishing the pleasant atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be eager to get to the pub, catch up with his friends, and enjoy the atmosphere of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be eager to get to the pub, catch up with his friends, and enjoy the atmosphere of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player

      Name

          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports. He is a working-class man who finds solace and belonging in familiar places like his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece. He values tradition and routine, preferring the comfort of the known over the unknown.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in lively conversation with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and anticipation of the upcoming game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, as it's his preferred pub for watching football games with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          (b) Yes
          Answer: (a)

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.

          Answer: Jacob Walker was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park, but is feeling down about missing out on a night out to watch a soccer game with them.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park, but is feeling down about missing out on a night out to watch a soccer game with them.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a complex emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of it and engage with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.

          Sensations and feelings: Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, frustrated, and lonely.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker was recently seen enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park, but is feeling down about missing out on a night out to watch a soccer game with them.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a complex emotional state.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, watching soccer, or relaxing in the park. However, he seems to be more selective about where he watches games and was disappointed when not all his friends went to his preferred pub.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, whether it's at a cafe, watching soccer, or relaxing in the park. However, he seems to be more selective about where he watches games and was disappointed when not all his friends went to his preferred pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game. He could also ask his friends where they would like to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?

    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.

          State

He prefers to watch games at The Golden Fleece, a pub that serves craft beers, ciders, and snacks. While he values his friendships, he can be disappointed when his friends don't share his enthusiasm for his preferred activities.

          current daily occupation: a working-class man who enjoys socializing with friends, particularly watching sports at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in lighthearted conversation with his friends, enjoying the sunshine and camaraderie.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in lighthearted conversation with his friends, enjoying the sunshine and camaraderie.

          Key

          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends who are lounging and enjoying the sunshine. Later that evening, the friends plan to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub.

        Overarching goal

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage, particularly when it comes to social gatherings and decisions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a little resentful.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and craves attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub for watching the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and craves attention.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class individual who enjoys manipulating situations to her advantage, particularly when it comes to social gatherings and decisions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling disappointed and perhaps a little resentful.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and craves attention.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and craves attention.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub for watching the game.

          Alice Lewis's
          Summary of recent observations:
          16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in Victoria Park with friends and will be watching the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is currently in Victoria Park with friends and will be watching the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub later.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends. Later that evening, she and her friends plan to watch the Serbia-Andorra game at The Golden Fleece pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great deals on beer and a nice outdoor area if the weather holds up.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great deals on beer and a nice outdoor area if the weather holds up.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
      William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
      Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
      Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great deals on beer and a nice outdoor area if the weather holds up.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: likely a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and slightly frustrated.
          core characteristics: a complex individual who values his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group. He has a strong desire to maintain a positive social image and can be manipulative to achieve this, often deflecting blame and subtly influencing others to align with his preferences. He is also a creature of habit, preferring familiar surroundings like his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game later that night. The group is considering The Golden Fleece or The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely try to persuade his friends to go to The Black Swan.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince the group to go to The Black Swan instead of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head to The Black Swan with Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob.
          [14 May 2015 11:30] Secure a good table at The Black Swan for the group.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Order drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Enjoy the Andorra vs Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great deals on beer and a nice outdoor area if the weather holds up.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred pub for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control and craves attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

  • scoring function
      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan

      Name
    • Alexander White

          Answer: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a socialite who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports at his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He tends to avoid taking responsibility for his mistakes and may try to shift blame onto others. He values maintaining a positive social image and can be persuasive in convincing his friends to join him in his preferred activities.
          current daily occupation: likely trying to persuade his friends to go to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated and perhaps a bit disappointed.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.
