        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially when it involves watching sports.

Alexander White just arrived.

          Answer: Alexander White is a social butterfly who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching sports.

          Answer: Alexander White is currently about to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would try to convince his friends to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      Name

          Answer: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and perhaps a little lonely.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching sports at his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports. He prefers to watch games at The Golden Fleece, a pub that serves craft beers, ciders, and snacks. He values camaraderie and often suggests that his friends join him for these outings. While he enjoys these gatherings, he seems to be happiest when all of his friends are present.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          Identity characteristics: feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed and perhaps a little lonely.
          current daily occupation: likely a working-class man who enjoys spending time with his friends, especially watching sports at his preferred pub, The Golden Fleece.
          core characteristics: a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports. He prefers to watch games at The Golden Fleece, a pub that serves craft beers, ciders, and snacks. He values camaraderie and often suggests that his friends join him for these outings. While he enjoys these gatherings, he seems to be happiest when all of his friends are present.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

          Answer

        • Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Golden Fleece, as it's his preferred pub for watching football games with friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to a fun evening with his friends, enjoying the atmosphere of the pub and the excitement of the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "So, who's up for some truly terrible puns about Andorra's chances tonight? Because I've got a whole arsenal ready to fire.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for catching the game at The Golden Fleece tonight?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in lighthearted conversation with his friends, enjoying the sunshine and camaraderie.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has some great deals on beer tonight. They also have a lovely outdoor seating area if the weather holds up.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Black Swan tonight? They've got great deals on beer and a nice outdoor area if the weather holds up.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual who enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly while watching sports.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations

          Value

          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely.

          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of it and engage with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would try to make the best of it and engage with his friends.
          Chain of thought

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of it and engage with his friends.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Key

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece or The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub alone, but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at the park the following day. They are now deciding where to watch another game with their friends that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Golden Fleece or The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he found himself at odds with his classmates who were planning a prank on a teacher they disliked. He calmly explained his perspective, emphasizing empathy and understanding, and managed to persuade them to reconsider their actions. This experience solidified his belief in the power of peaceful resolution.

          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Golden Fleece to watch the game with his friends.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Golden Fleece.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be enjoying the company of his friends, perhaps engaging in conversation, sharing stories, or simply relishing the pleasant atmosphere.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, snuck into a late-night showing of a classic horror film. The flickering images on the screen, the eerie soundtrack, and the palpable tension in the darkened theater ignited a thrill within him that he'd never experienced before. He reveled in the fear, the adrenaline coursing through his veins, and the shared experience of terror with his friends.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20, he convinced his friends to host a themed party at The Golden Fleece, transforming the quirky pub into a mock medieval banquet hall. He spent weeks meticulously crafting costumes, designing elaborate decorations, and planning intricate games, pouring his energy and passion into creating an unforgettable experience. He thrived on the chaos of the night, the laughter, the costumes, and the sheer absurdity of it all, reveling in the role of the master of ceremonies.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
    Active player

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Queries

          State
        • core characteristics: evasive and avoids taking responsibility for his mistakes.
          current daily occupation: likely watching the European football cup game with his friends at The Golden Fleece.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling frustrated.

          Value
        • Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.


          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex individual who appears to value his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be eager to get to the pub and enjoy the game with his friends.

          Plan: [14 May 2015 10:30] Convince the group to go to The Black Swan instead of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 11:00] Head to The Black Swan with Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob.
          [14 May 2015 11:30] Secure a good table at The Black Swan for the group.
          [14 May 2015 12:00] Order drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 19:00] Enjoy the Andorra vs Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex individual who appears to value his friendships and enjoys socializing, particularly watching sports with his close-knit group.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.

        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he was caught cheating on a history test. Instead of admitting fault, he spun a tale about a friend pressuring him to copy the answers, deflecting blame and earning only a minor reprimand.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, William, and Jacob, were planning a surprise party for another friend at The Black Swan. Alexander, eager to impress, volunteered to secure the reservations, but double-booked the table. Instead of owning up to his mistake, he convinced the group that the pub had made an error, subtly shifting the blame and avoiding any negative attention.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are planning to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Golden Fleece pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

          Queries

          current daily occupation: likely unemployed and enjoying his leisure time.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with his friends and watching the game.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a sociable and down-to-earth individual.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaged in lively conversation with his friends, enjoying the camaraderie and anticipation of the upcoming game.

          Plan: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)
          Question: Write Jack Taylor's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14:00 - 16:00] Continue enjoying the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head towards The Golden Fleece, Jack Taylor's preferred pub for watching the game.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Settle in at The Golden Fleece, order some drinks and snacks, and chat with friends before the game starts.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends, cheering them on and enjoying the pub atmosphere.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Discuss the game with friends, perhaps have another drink, and enjoy the post-game buzz.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he stumbled upon a hidden bookstore tucked away on a quiet side street. The musty scent of old paper and leather enveloped him as he browsed the shelves, discovering forgotten histories and untold stories. He felt a sense of belonging amidst the silent whispers of the past, a refuge from the chaotic uncertainty of adolescence.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later that evening.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: manipulative and enjoys being the center of attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of disappointment and resignation.

        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game later that night. They are deciding between The Golden Fleece and The Black Swan.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she convinced her entire class that she had a secret admirer who sent her love letters penned in elegant calligraphy. The truth was, Alice had written the letters herself, carefully crafting a persona of a mysterious, lovestruck suitor. The attention and envy she received fueled her desire to manipulate and control the narrative.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Alice Lewis's
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.

          The current time is: [14 May 2015 10:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (a)
          Question: Write Alice Lewis's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
      Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
      Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.
          Chain of thought

          ['[15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual with a need for control and attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and possibly a bit resentful about the outcome of the previous night.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Where else would we go? It's the only place with a proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, guys, how about we try The Black Swan tonight? They have great deals on beer during the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual with a manipulative streak and a deep-seated need for attention.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location, The Black Swan, possibly by subtly highlighting its advantages or downplaying the appeal of The Golden Fleece.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "You know, The Black Swan has those amazing beer deals during the game, right?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, The Golden Fleece is showing the game tonight, right?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece it is then. I'll grab a round in when we get there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who enjoys being in control.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely try to convince her friends to go to her preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex and manipulative individual with a need for control and attention.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling disappointed and possibly a bit resentful about the outcome of the previous night.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and manipulative person who craves attention and control.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social setting with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely try to steer the group towards her preferred location for watching the game.

          15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis arrived at a bustling market where friends were enjoying coffee and pastries and is later planning to watch a soccer game with friends.
          Alice Lewis's The current date/time is:
          15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently at a market and will be watching a soccer game with friends later.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis is currently at a market and will be watching a soccer game with friends later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alice Lewis to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Casually suggest to the group that The Black Swan might be a good option for watching the game, highlighting its deals on beer and perhaps mentioning a pleasant atmosphere.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Engage in lighthearted conversation, subtly steering the conversation towards The Black Swan's positive attributes while downplaying any mention of The Golden Fleece.
          [16:00 - 17:00] If the group remains undecided, propose a vote between the two pubs, subtly encouraging votes for The Black Swan.
          [17:00 - 18:00] If The Black Swan is chosen, express enthusiasm and excitement about the choice. If The Golden Fleece is chosen, feign disappointment but agree to go along with the majority.
          [19:00 - 20:00] Arrive at the chosen pub and order drinks, ensuring everyone is comfortable and having a good time.
          [20:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the game, actively participate in the atmosphere, and make sure everyone is enjoying themselves.
