          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking insult comic, their humor as dark as a moonless night, leaving you unsure whether to laugh or crawl under the table.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Golden Fleece and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, disappointed, and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social dilemma.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would try to make the best of it and engage with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Golden Fleece
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and enthusiastic person who enjoys spending time with friends, particularly in festive or exciting settings.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would probably try to make the best of the situation and engage with his friends, hoping to lift his spirits.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Golden Fleece, obviously. Nowhere else has the proper atmosphere for a game like this.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is much better for watching the game, lads. They have a bigger screen and better atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Golden Fleece is the only place to watch it, lads.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would probably try to make the best of the situation and engage with his friends, hoping to lift his spirits.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub alone, but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at the park the following day. They are now deciding where to watch another game with their friends that evening.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Black Swan.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have.
